STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ELIZABETH HERTEL
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
September 15, 2021
Julie Waldron
Cheboygan/Presque Isle County DHHS
827 S Huron Street
Cheboygan, MI 49721
RE: License #: CP160201035
Cheboygan/Presque Isle County DHHS
827 S Huron Street
Cheboygan, MI 49721
Dear Ms. Waldron:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
08/31/2021. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should
be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the
MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular certificate of approval
license will be issued. If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan,
disciplinary action will result.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Claudia Triestram, Area Manager at (616) 552-3662.
Sincerely,
Don Collier, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
Suite 11
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City, MI 49684
(231) 342-5326
enclosure
2

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12324 Reevaluation.
(8) An agency shall complete a reevaluation and shall make a
licensing recommendation to the department at least 15
calendar days before the expiration date of the foster home
license.
One of 3 foster home files reviewed in MiSACWIS (Michigan Statewide Automated
Child Welfare Information System) had a reevaluation approval date of 07/01/2021
and a foster home expiration date of 07/04/2021.
R 400.12326 Borrowed home.
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by another
agency or tribe, the agency shall have a record containing all of
the following documents:
(h) A copy of the current children's foster home license
application and children's foster home licensing transaction
record documents from the certifying agency.
One of 1 borrowed foster home file reviewed did not contain current children's foster
home license application and children's foster home licensing transaction record
documents from the certifying agency.
R 400.12326 Borrowed home.
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by another
agency or tribe, the agency shall have a record containing all of
the following documents:
(i) A copy of all special evaluations completed during the last
2 years.
One of 1 borrowed foster home file reviewed did not contain a special evaluation
completed on 09/23/2020 by the certifying agency.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
4

3.) Please note that there are additional DHHS Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is incompliance will all additional DHHS Policy
requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Technical Assistance was not required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
 Foster Home closing documents need to be placed in the document section of
the Provider section of MiSACWIS.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
AND
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The agency was cited for the following at the 10/06/2020 Interim Inspection:
 ISEP 6.33 Assessment and Service Plans
 FOM 722-08C Parent-Agency Treatment Plans
A corrective action plan was approved on 12/10/2020 and there were no repeat
violations.
VII. CHIEF ADMINISTRATOR ASSESSMENT
The Chief Administrator Assessment was completed on 08/23/2021. It showed a
thorough review of foster care services files and a corrective action plan to resolve
what she had found.
Interviews
The supervisor and foster care workers interviewed felt supported and are provided
the tools they need to perform their role.
VIII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
5

IX. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will
be issued a renewal of their regular license.
September 13, 2021
________________________________________
Don Collier Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
September 15, 2021
________________________________________
Claudia Triestram Date
Area Manager
